page.title: 16 Castle Museum (One).
page.content: As the name suggests Tamworth's most famous building is both a Castle and a Museum. It is {open} every day except Friday and Sunday morning from ten in the morning until five-thirty. On Sundays it is open from two until five-thirty. Adults pay sixty-five pence and children twenty pence. The castle was bought by the town in 1897, the year of Queen Victoria's Diamond Jubilee, and two years later the Museum opened. In the {Great Hall} there is some chain mail and weapons, an Elizabethan dress and some furniture. The wall has oak panels. The largest item is a Tudor Table. Upstairs is a variety of rooms. The Long Gallery has a history of Tamworth including the Saxon Mill.
